Name: طورعبين
id: mountainous area stretching roughly from the area northeast of Mardin to Jazirat Ibn ʿUmar (modern Cizre) in the east, to where the Batman Su joins the Tigris in the north and the tablelands sloping to the North Syrian Plain in the south. See EI2 ("Tur ʿAbdin", Streck/Bosworth/Heinrichs).

Name: رأس العين
location_certainty: no specific clues for an exact location
Comments: Copper only 181-224 H, 274 H (Diler, vol. I).

Name: سميساط
id: Pleiades: ancient Samosata; the ruins were submerged following the construction of the Ataturk dam. The modern village of Samsat does not coincide with this site. The ANE place marker is in the same place. Pace EI2 ("Sumaysat", C. P. Haase), which argues that the modern village does in fact coincide with the ancient place, at least preserving Roman elements in the city walls. I have chosen to follow both PL and ANE in placing the marker.
loc: ANE Place marker for Kummuhu / Samosata (Samsat)

Name: قرقيسية
